Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Build a solid base

An Associate of General Studies provides an excellent, well-rounded base for students who want to pursue a bachelor's degree or immediate employment. Students who plan on transferring to another university are encouraged to finish their associate's to maximize the transferability of their credits.

What are the classes like?

BYU-Idaho's online courses mirror campus courses. They follow the same semester format and use the learning model. Student will have regular due dates for assignments and should expect to interact with their instructors and peers often.

How long will this program take?

Our online degree program allows students the flexibility to finish their degree while balancing a busy life. Students can accelerate to graduation by taking classes all three semesters each year, or take a semester off when needed. Students must complete the program within four years.

What will I study?

In addition to the foundation requirements students may choose one cluster of their choice. Talk to your advisor about online clusters.

View all degree requirements in the University Catalog and check course availability.

Is this a good fit for me?

Where do I begin?

Students who meet the admission requirements can apply to be directly admitted into a online degree program. These students will start by taking the online orientation course, a one credit course offered every block. This course prepares students to succeed online and charts a course to graduation. Pathway students who complete Academic Start do not need to take GS 111.

Have questions?

We're ready to talk! Call us at (866) 672-2984 or email us at onlinelearning@byui.edu, or text your question to (208) 557-4132.
